The next time I enter to give birth, Dr. Juan Carlos Morales is great as always a professional, once I gave birth, the problems return, among all I highlight the 2 worst, after spending hours in the room without any visit from a midwife or nurse, a boy comes and tells my husband to put on the surgical gown that we are leaving, they took me down to put epidurals and monitors around 5:00 p.m. and until 9:45 p.m. my family did not know anything about us, they asked about me but they said they had to wait. At least they could warn of the operation ......

They finally had to completely anesthetize me, and everything went well, they woke me up in the same operating room and everyone was very attentive, especially the midwife Itsasu López de Sosoaga. Dr. Morales visits me in the room where they took me to recover, and when he saw that I was nervous because it was all very fast and I did not see the girl, believing that something had happened, he came again to show me a photo of my baby and my husband! That gesture was wonderful! He told me that in 30 min. I could go up to the floor, BUT it took 2 and a half hours !! The explanation is that there is a lack of staff .... I found my baby crying inconsolably as she wanted to breastfeed !! A real disappointment.

I have explained errors that hurt me the most since I paid a mutual so that this would not happen to me in public, but there were many more errors! A shame but I will not return.

No sé qué pasa con Quirón, pero 2 de los 3 hospitales que conozco funcionan de pena (el de Toledo y este). Para hacer una prueba con anestesia a un niño de 2 años te piden firmar, enseñar el DNI del padre o madre y la tarjeta sanitaria del niño. Para recoger el resultado te piden presentar libro de familia, DNI y si me apuras orden notarial, a pesar de estar acreditado como padre/tutor en la aplicación QuironSalud presentando en su momento copia del libro de familia o certificado de nacimiento, y asistir a infinidad de consultas solamente con su tarjeta sanitaria (teniendo cómo cobrar no hay problema, claro). Repito, para hacerle la prueba, una prueba con anestesia, con la firma ya vale (con los riesgos que entraña,...), para recoger el resultado el padre o la madre, ya te puedes ir preparando. Está bien la protección de datos, pero sean coherentes en todo, y no pidan 20 veces algo de lo que ya se les presentó copia digitalizada en su momento. Además, al hacerle la prueba nadie nos dió ningún papel de recogida de resultados (cosa que dicen que dan), sólo me dijo el médico que a partir del día siguiente podía recoger el resultado y punto. Quirón: de vergüenza. Y no doy 1 estrella por algunos médicos del centro, porque si fuera por la gestión... 👎👎

To collect the result, they ask you to present a family book, ID and if you hurry a notarial order, despite being accredited as a parent / guardian in the QuironSalud application, presenting at the time a copy of the family book or birth certificate, and attending infinity of consultations only with your health card (having how to charge there is no problem, of course). I repeat, to do the test, a test with anesthesia, with the signature it is worth it (with the risks that it entails, ...), to collect the result the father or the mother, you can start preparing. El trato médico paciente es muy bueno, son buenos profesionales, pero el problema principal es la gestión. No vayas si quieres una atención rápida, hay semanas de espera. Cuando consigues la cita con el especialista y te pide una prueba, tienes que esperar otras 3 semanas y para volverte a citar con el mismo, 1mes.
En las consultas el tiempo de espera es largo, unos 40 mins, más el tiempo que tienes que esperar para decir en la recepción del servicio que estás ahí y que tienes cita a x horas. Ya podrían poner alguna máquina.
Yo personalmente he ido por múltiples causas y siempre que salgo pienso que no vuelvo. No hay cobertura, tampoco wifi ni es fácil aparcar. Si te tratan un proceso agudo, olvídate, ellos lo vuelven crónico con la lista de espera.
Quieres ir al trauma y rehabilitación? No vayas:
-1: cita con trauma al mes
-2: Cuando el trauma te pide una prueba, te la hacen al mes.
-3: le llevas los resultados y te deriva a rehabilitación (otra semanita más)
-4: el rehabilitador te pide más pruebas, las cuales te las dan semanas después.

Conclusión, quédate en casa que la enfermedad se te va a curar antes que en la Quiron.

The patient medical treatment is very good, they are good professionals, but the main problem is management. Do not go if you want quick attention, there are weeks of waiting. When you get the appointment with the specialist and he asks for a test, you have to wait another 3 weeks and to make an appointment with him again, 1 month.
In consultations, the waiting time is long, about 40 minutes, plus the time you have to wait to say at the reception of the service that you are there and that you have an appointment at x hours. They could already put a machine.
I have personally gone for multiple reasons and whenever I go out I think I will not return. There is no coverage, no wifi nor is it easy to park. If they treat an acute process, forget it, they make it chronic with the waiting list.
Do you want to go to trauma and rehab? Do not go:
-1: trauma appointment per month
-2: When the trauma asks you for a test, they do it every month.
-3: you bring him the results and he refers you to rehab (another week)
-4: the rehabilitator asks you for more tests, which they give you weeks later.

Conclusion, stay at home that the disease will be cured before in the Chiron.

Vamos que una experiencia lamentable con éste hospital que creo que va a morir de éxito.

The truth is that a great disappointment with this Hospital, we were for the most beautiful moment that a person can have that is the birth of their baby and from the time we entered the hospital it was not how we expected.
A cold and not very close treatment from the reception and with all kinds of problems.
We had to enter for induced labor and they kept us waiting in the emergency room for a long time and, on top of that, they had misrepresented the day they had told us for admission and even asked if we had gone the night before to the emergency room when it was not like that, we go a disaster.
Upon reaching the room we find that the sofa where the father has to sleep is in very bad condition and the waiting chair seems to have been taken from a container.
They do not inform us that when entering and starting with the preparation for childbirth you can neither eat nor drink, when putting the tracks they put a student who destroys my wife's arm.
When we went down to the dilatation room we found a tiny room and a hard plastic chair that is extremely uncomfortable where the father has to sit for many hours.
The gynecologist who carried the pregnancy, a person with little empathy and little close to the parents, did not tell anything if you did not ask, in the last visits after almost 9 months she asked if it was a boy or a girl (at least the report should be read before the entry of each mother) and not content with that, the gynecologist who has carried the pregnancy is not present at the delivery.
We are going to have an unfortunate experience with this hospital that I think will die of success.

Se fue con la moto que había dejado en la misma puerta y ahí nos dejó. Como el médico estaba seguro de que sí lo era, decidió ingresarla hasta que la viese otro cirujano. Estuvo 5 días allí y le dieron el alta después de mil pruebas en las que "no vieron nada". Poco después volvió por la Seguridad Social y de cabeza a quirófano, apendicitis.
Para colmo, el hospital envió una factura al seguro que nos reclamaron, diciendo que había estado allí por gusto, reclamando 2000 euros porque consideraban que la paciente estaba sana, a lo que obviamente contestamos con el informe de la Seguridad Social y ya se callaron la boquita.

Yo acudo a la doctora Vilariño en trauma porque es muy buena, y siempre espero mínimo DOS HORAS. Además el persobal de recepción te dice que es lo que hay. La culpa no es de la doctora, sino de la mala gestión.

Quisiera compartir mi experiencia de ayer 14 de Noviembre de 2018,reconozco que estaba un poco inquieto por las opiniones leídas en la web de algunos pacientes.Pues bien os cuento mi experiencia,sin duda alguna excelente ,llegué en helicóptero a Málaga desde Ceuta y me dirigí hacia el Hospital Quirón salud de Málaga,decir que iba para hacerme una litotricia extracorporea en la zona renal derecha,pues bien,se cumplieron todos los horarios,gracias a María José que fue mi enlace telefónico desde el principio,buen trabajo,muy agradable y atenta,por otro lado las personas que me trataron que recuerdo sus nombres:Jesús(creo que era técnico de rayos),Ana(Enfermera) y la Doctora García,fueron muy cariñosos y profesionales conmigo,decir que yo llevo un catéter doble j,los que llevamos esto ya sabemos lo doloroso que es,a mi me trataron de maravilla.No sé si les llegará está información y me encantaría que sus jefes los felicitasen por su buen hacer.A modo de sugerencia estaría bien que las personas que en este caso estén en adimisision sonrieran un poco al atender a los que llegamos,en mi caso que iba de desde Ceuta que precisamente no está cerca,me sorprendió que siendo la primera imagen que tiene la empresa fuese así,ojo fue correcta,muy secas sobre todo una de las chicas,pero correctas,pero el trato del equipo de litotricia compensó de sobra la primera imagen que tuve del hospital.Agradecerles su buen hacer y atención,Ceuta tiene algunas carencias a nivel sanitario y el boca-oído en esta ciudad es muy relevante,es más después de mi entraba otra chica de Ceuta.Por lo que recomandaré el hospital o al menos al equipo de Litotricia a las personas que conozco.Gracias.

Mi valoración corresponde al servicio de urgencias. El día 21 de Agosto esperé unas 3 horas en urgencias (de 13.25 a 16.40)para que me trataran de una picadura de avispa infectada, lo que me provocó una inflamación desde la axila al codo con terribles picores. En ningún momento tienes información de cuántas personas tienes delante ni cuánto tiempo falta para que te atiendan, por la información que hay en pantalla parece que solo funcionaban dos boxes cuando en la sala había unas 40 personas.  El tiempo de espera fue para mí excesivo en mis circunstancias, pero peor aún fue presenciar el caso de otros pacientes. En particular una señora en silla de ruedas, acompañada por su hija con graves deficiencias motorias, la señora quería ir al baño y se llamó al celador para que la acompañara, tardando éste más de 15 minutos en acudir. A todos los que estábamos allí se nos partía el corazón de ver la situación, menos por lo visto al personal que debía atender y auxiliar a esta familia que claramente tenía necesidades especiales, a esa señora no le tenían que haber hecho ni esperar las 3 horas que esperamos los demás.

Continúo contando, al poco tiempo mi mujer acude a urgencias de madrugada, con un fuerte dolor de ovario, y quién si no, nos atiende el mismo e incompetente médico de urgencias, el cual tras una atención que deja mucho que desear, le dice a mi mujer que lo que tiene son dolores causados por gases acumulados y nos manda para casa. A primera hora de la mañana , su dolor es insoportable, y de nuevo acudimos a urgencias, con la mala suerte que nos atiende el mismo médico, que viene a contarnos la misma historia de los gases, cuándo puedo ver a lo lejos otro doctor (un ángel Salvador caído del cielo), al cual tras contarle todo lo ocurrido , mostrando todo el interés que un médico profesional debe de tener, se preocupa por hacerle todas las pruebas oportunas para solucionar los dolores de mi mujer, metiéndola a quirófano de urgencia, donde le quitaron un quiste de 10 cm que le estaba descolgando el útero de su lugar.
Bueno pues sigo contando. Pasado un año de la operación, tenemos que volver a urgencias, tras varios desmayos de mi mujer, con pérdida de consciencia, blanca como una sábana, y quién nos atiende, sí, el mismo médico incompetente de los gases, el cual daba tumbos  sin saber que hacer . Cuando de repente vuelvo a ver al ángel Salvador, que tras dirigirme a el , le  explico nuestra nueva experiencia, y tras atender a mi mujer , de nuevo muy profesionalmente, es operada de urgencia, casi a vida o muerte, tras tener una herida interna por la que había perdido ya más de dos litros de sangre.
Conclusión, rezad para no ser atendidos en urgencias por el médico incompetente, y si es así, buscar rápido al otro doctor.
Tengo más historia para contar , igual de mala , pero creo que ya me van a llamar la atención con tanto texto.

I do not know how much I can summarize my dire experience with this hospital. I start by making a tear in the biceps tendon of my right arm, in the emergency department a doctor treats me (if you can call it that, because I doubt that I have the studies for that, and later you will understand why I say it), which without realizing me No type of test, he puts me in a sling and tells me that I may have some fibrillar tear, that in a couple of weeks I go to the orthopedist. When I go to the orthopedic surgeon, he tells me that in the emergency room they should have done at least one ultrasound and operated on without delay. (Now the biceps has healed badly, with its consequences).
I continue counting, soon after my wife goes to the emergency room at dawn, with severe ovarian pain, and who else, the same incompetent emergency doctor treats us, who after care that leaves much to be desired, tells My wife says that what she has is pain caused by accumulated gases and she sends us home. First thing in the morning, his pain is unbearable, and again we go to the emergency room, with the bad luck that the same doctor treats us, who comes to tell us the same story of gases, when can I see another doctor in the distance ( a Savior angel fallen from heaven), to whom after telling everything that happened, showing all the interest that a professional doctor must have, he worries about doing all the appropriate tests to solve my wife's pain, putting her in an emergency operating room, where they removed a 10 cm cyst that was pulling the uterus out of its place.
Well I keep counting. A year after the operation, we have to return to the emergency room, after several faints of my wife, with loss of consciousness, white as a sheet, and who treats us, yes, the same incompetent gas doctor, who was stumbling without know what to do . When suddenly I see the angel Salvador again, who after addressing him, I explain our new experience, and after attending to my wife, again very professionally, she is operated urgently, almost to life or death, after having an internal wound for which he had already lost more than two liters of blood.
Conclusion, pray not to be seen in the emergency room by the incompetent doctor, and if so, quickly find the other doctor.
I have more story to tell, just as bad, but I think they are going to catch my attention with so much text.

El caso es que finalmente han recetado enantyum, a un adolescente de 14 años, cuando el prospecto especifica que está contraindicado para menores de 18 años. Además han recetado también Paracetamol, sin indicar que deberían alternarse. Tendría que darle los dos al mismo tiempo? Por mis nociones médicas entiendo que no, pero la doctora no ha indicado nada al respecto. Si vuelvo a tener una urgencia, iré a vigo que, aunque está mas lejos, acabaría tardando menos. We entered at 2.30pm with sprained ankle, possible sprain. After two hours of waiting, they pass us to a box, where we continue to wait for more than half an hour and without even Rx. The fact that it is summer is no excuse, that they hire the necessary personnel. The fact is that enantyum has finally been prescribed to a 14-year-old adolescent, when the prospectus specifies that it is contraindicated for people under 18 years of age. They have also prescribed Paracetamol, without indicating that they should be alternated. Should I give him both at the same time? By my medical notions I understand that no, but the doctor has not indicated anything in this regard. If I have an emergency again, I will go to vigo which, although it is further away, would end up taking less time. I understand that in emergencies you have to wait but not because there is only one doctor and a brutal lack of foresight and organization

I'm surprised to see so many negative reviews here. My experience was definitely 5 stars. I went there this morning with my daughter who had dislocated her elbow. From the minute we arrived everyone was so helpful and so friendly. My daughter is only 3 and everyone made her feel safe and comfortable. From the receptionist Becky to the first doctor we met to the Radiographer to the orthopaedic staff, all were very professional and efficient. We are on family holiday and were quite upset that our daughter was in pain. We were in and out of this hospital in 2 hours with my daughter well and happy. Thank you so much for taking care of her. We can now continue to enjoy our holiday. And I would recommend you to anyone needing care in Tenerife while on holiday.

If your child becomes seriously unwell whilst holidaying in Tenerife please do not go to this hospital, please go to the Candelaria hospital in Santa Cruz. The Candelaria is a public hospital with a peadiatric department. Our son was seriously ill and was not treated well or given appropriate care at the Quiron hospital. The staff were rude, and very rough with our baby and dismissive of our concerns. We asked to be transferred and received much better care at the Candelaria. Extremely disappointing for a private hospital where you have to pay before any care is provided.

My wife’s uncle got taken here without any knowledge of it being a private hospital, he is 67 and had just finished treatment for prostate cancer. As soon as we found out and stated we needed to get taken to a public hospital we were treated like second rate citizens and made to wait over 2 hours before they transported him, they were however very keen to hit his sister and brother in law (69 and 70) with over a 1400 Euro bill. At no point was anyone told it was private until it was to late, beware holiday makers this place is just one big scam to rip off the most vulnerable.

In response to the message from the hospital itself below my answer is no as I’m more than happy for this to be played out in public rather than swept under the carpet. It’s a great scheme to rip tourist off when they’re at their most desperate, you go to the hotel reception and inform them you need a doctor, they call a private doctor without your knowledge, who then call a private ambulance without your knowledge who take you to a private hospital, by the time you find out your in the private sector and your insurance doesn’t cover you you’ve already racked up an astronomical bill. To put in in perspective my wife’s uncle was treated with oxygen and by the time we realised, paid the bill and asked to be transferred to a public hospital within 2 hours had a bill for over 1400 euros. The public hospital is 5 minutes away but we were left waiting there for a further 2 hours before he was moved whilst there was 2-3 ambulances sat outside doing nothing because as far as the hospital staff were concerned they had there money and had literally pulled the plug as soon as we stated we wanted to be moved, moved by an ambulance we had already paid for by the way!. It’s an absolute scandal.

le aviso y me dice ahora pasaré.

This is a review of the laboratory service at Palmaplanas, which I can NOT recommend. I will start with the good part: the lab itself is modern and clean. That's about it. Do not get your blood drawn there unless you want to face ridiculous rules invented by them because you are a client and a number to them, not a patient. They will literally send a tired cancer patient home because they decide they only draw blood between 8 and 9 am. The *secretary* (let that sink in) will make it seem like it's the only time your blood values are valid, when this is absolute unscientific bullsh*t (as confirmed by our doctor). We were also reprimanded for "sleeping in" - YEAH, SORRY TO BE DYING. We have taken our business elsewhere (Policlínica Miramar, they will draw your blood at ANY time between 8 am and 8pm *and* are friendly to their patients). Thank you for nothing, Palmaplanas.

Hoy visitè  Urgencias del centre Medic Tecknon con un dolor agudo casi insoportable en mi glúteo derecho producido por una inflamación del nervio Ciático, y he de decir que el trato de recepción y el pre-consulta con el traumatológo de guardia ha sido el peor trato de atención médica que he recibido en mi vida, yo manifesté tanto al llegar como al de suministrar mis datos a la enfermera que NO soportaba estar ni sentada, ni parada por que el espasmo sobre el area afectada era insoportable literalmente, no hubo ninguna acción por parte del personal para hacerme permanecer recostada el tiempo de espera, que se convirtió en una tortura de casi 2 horas.
No hubo ningún gesto de amabilidad o de gentileza en las personas que me atendieron ni antes ,ni durante ni después de la visita.

Una vez atendida por el traumatologo de guardia cuyo examen exploratorio duró aproximadamente 2 minutos, en los cuales apenas si se interesó en mi explicación de los síntomas, concluyò su diagnóstico, el l cual corroboraría en alguna nueva consulta en base a un eco que me harían eventualmente de forma ambulatoria después, porque en urgencias no se contempla la posibilidad de hacer un ecosonograma.
Despues de el, llegò   una enfermera que no supo decirme que me estaban inyectando y me hicieron salir inmediatamente del cubiculo.
Gran sensación de abandono y poca consideración con alguien que acude en busca de ayuda. No recomiendo esta experiencia en modo alguno.

Today I visited the Emergency Department of the Medic Tecknon center with an almost unbearable acute pain in my right gluteus caused by an inflammation of the sciatic nerve, and I have to say that the reception treatment and the pre-consultation with the trauma surgeon on duty has been the worst treatment of medical care that I have received in my life, I stated both when I arrived and when I gave my information to the nurse that I could NOT stand sitting or sitting, or standing because the spasm over the affected area was literally unbearable, there was no action on my part staff to make me lie down the waiting time, which turned into a torture of almost 2 hours.
There was no gesture of kindness or kindness in the people who attended to me before, during or after the visit.

Once attended by the on-call traumatologist whose exploratory examination lasted approximately 2 minutes, in which she was hardly interested in my explanation of the symptoms, she concluded her diagnosis, which I would corroborate in a new consultation based on an echo that they would make me eventually on an outpatient basis afterwards, because the possibility of doing an ecosonogram is not considered in the emergency department.

. I have a condition in one of my eyes and so far non of the tests done in the Quiron hospital has given any insight on the reason for this - the eye "specialist" did not let me talk, wanted me to read some letters which were displayed on the wall -  and when I told him that I had a severe problem and he should look actually into the computer system to see the tests which already have been done - he got all snippy and wanted to put drops in my eyes without even checking if I was wearing contact lenses.
I have never had such a bad experience in the Quiron .He then asked my husband and I to leave the consultation room while I removed my lenses- it seemed to us that he was more interested in getting as many patients through his consultation room as fast as possible !
I decided to leave the consultation as I  no longer wanted to waste my time . Then when I tried  to complain ( I went into the reception of the main hospital for this together with my husband who was with me all the time ) the staff there could not find the complaint form and when I asked if I could talk to somebody to make my complaint in person they said they did not know who that would be - WOW, I am very surprised that the hospital Quiron which has kind of a good reputation  allows doctors like this eye doctor to practice on their premises -  shocking behaviour!

Before my planned hopital treatment I read the numerous reviews about the Quiron Hospital based in Marbella.

Reviews were very mixed yet it was the hospital recommended by my health insurance company for my eye cataract procedure.

Having now had the procedure two days ago,  I can in fact highly recommend the hospital staff, nurses and doctors who treated me with utmost courtesy.

They provided an excellent professional and highly competent technical service; from the administrative staff to the technical excellence of the opthalmic surgeon who seamlessly completed my cataract procedure.

Therefore I have no hesitation in recommending this hospital for anybody requiring a similar procedure.

The surgical procedure was carried out by external opthamologist Dra. Gloria Carretero and her surgical support team.

Frederick Millan. (UK).

I had surgery 2 months ago and the treatment of the staff was excellent. The medical team was very attentive to me and the nurses were very nice. I have also been to the emergency room on another occasion with subsequent admission and they treated me for 10. I hope it continues like this.

Admitted last night after blacking out, and falling down on the roadside concrete. Alcohol WAS NOT involved. Saw admission doctor in the emergency department who did a general medical examination" - heartbeat, poke your tongue out etc- and sent for a neck x-ray, and CAT scan of brain. I had fallen twice, had a thumping headache (which l am not prone to) and suffered a huge raspberry coloured haematoma on the back of my skull. He wasn't interested. Next thing l'm told in a very loud voice in front of a room full of people having solutions dripped into their arms that this doctor wants to admit me. No particular reason was given so when l said l would actually prefer to go home the doctor's voice rose even more as he shouted l would have to sign a release form absolving the hospital etc. There was no privacy, this exchange took place in a public treatment room & the corridor outside.
I decided to stay the night as l still had the headache & no real medical explanation of why l might have fallen. Upstairs l went to a room. Someone brought a tray of very ordinary luke warm food and a nurse took my bood pressure and inserted an incredibly slow saline drip into the cathetar the emergency nurse had installed.
Since then no one has entered my room except a breakfast lady.
I understood l was being admitted to be monitored. Not a soul apart from the breakfast lady has been near me for 12 hours. Certainly there has not been any care, monitoring or communication. And ... the noise in the area outside my room has been unnecessarily loud since 5am - banging of containers, doors slamming, metal dropping, staff shouting, laughing and general merriment.
So, no monitoring, no explanations, no care, and despite the hospital's promise to investigate previous grieviances on this site l feel this was a total money-grab by Quiron.

El médico me dijo que con el informe ME FUERA A BUSCAR EL ANTIBIOTICO QUE ME INDICO A LA FARMACIA ESO A LAS 4 DE LA MADRUGADA Y CON FIEBRE, que si me sentía peor voviera.
Otro dato de urgencias el marco de la puerta 2 de Trillaje es mágica, ya me ha pasado 3 veces de ir con fiebre y al cruzar la puerta te baja la fiebre un grado y medio si vas con 38 en Trillaje se te queda en que no llega a 37.
Os preguntaréis como lo se ante la duda de lo que ya me pasó otras veces tengo actualmente 3 termómetros en casa todos de marca comprados en farmacia, antes de ir me tomé la temperatura con los tres el que menos me dio 37'9 C cuando pase al trillaje me había bajado la temperatura a 36'9 C , me lleve uno de los termómetros al pasar a la sala de espera me volví a tomar la temperatura con el mío, en tres pasos volvía a tener 38:00.
CAMBIEN TERMOMETRO DE TRILLAJE O PIDAN QUE LOS ENFERMOS LLEVEN SU PROPIO TERMOMETRO.

(Translated by Google) Above the excellent design, location and aesthetics that it has, I have to highlight the magnificent professionalism and human quality of the entire team, at least, I can affirm it, of all the people of the team with whom I have dealt.

In view of the results of the tests, the doctors decided to admit this person, who has opened one of the magnificent rooms of the hospital complex.

It is clear that opening a hospital room is not something that anyone wants, but if you are in the position, as has happened to us, you always want the best for your family member and it has been.

One-person room, spacious, well lit, good views, well insulated thermally and acoustically and with a surprising endowment of services: last generation bed for the patient, sofa bed for the companion, comfort armchair and from a closet, with a safe in its Inside, even an Ipad from which the TV is operated, the menu for the patient is requested or the clinical history is accessed. A la vista de los resultados de las pruebas, los facultativos decidieron ingresar a esta persona, que ha estrenado una de las magníficas habitaciones del complejo hospitalario.

Buenas,

Después de escribir la reseña se han puesto en contacto conmigo diciéndome que ha sido un mal entendido y solucionandome el problema; con un buen servicio de atención al cliente.

ESTAFADO

Hace un mes tenía un quiste branquial diagnosticado por la seguridad social, ante la falta de agilidad por parte de esta llame a Quirón preguntando si ellos hacian estás operaciones, la chica de recepción consulto con el médico y este le dijo que necesitaba verme para saberlo,

Llego a la consulta en la que me atiende el doctor LUIS PADILLA RUIZ, quien confirma que tengo un quiste branquial y me aconseja operarlo en la seguridad social ya que es una operación complicada y cara, que aún así me dice que me mandará un presupuesto, a día de hoy un mes después todavía no tengo dicho presupuesto.

Mi impresión después de esto es que por una visita de 10 minutos pague 110 € y que este médico se aprovecho de mi desesperación para hacer caja, ya que sabía antes de verme que no iban a realizar está operación.

Un saludo

(Translated by Google)
Good,

After writing the review they have contacted me telling me that it has been a misunderstanding and solving the problem for me; with good customer service.

CHEATED

A month ago I had a branchial cyst diagnosed by social security, due to the lack of agility on the part of it, I called Chiron asking if they were doing these operations, the girl at the reception consulted with the doctor and he told him that he needed to see me to find out,

I arrive at the consultation where Dr. LUIS PADILLA RUIZ treats me, who confirms that I have a branchial cyst and advises me to operate it in the social security since it is a complicated and expensive operation, which still tells me that he will send me a budget, Today, a month later, I still don't have that budget.

My impression after this is that for a 10 minute visit I paid € 110 and that this doctor took advantage of my desperation to make money, since he knew before seeing me that they were not going to perform this operation.

All the best

Tras realizarme intervención de vasectomia el 26/6/2018, hoy me han dado el alta médica....igual la seguridad social hubiera tardado menos.

El engaño por parte de las operadoras telefónicas, diciendo que me llamaría el médico cuando no estaría en el hospital hasta 10 días después.
Informarme que no hay servicio de atención al paciente para el día siguiente decirme que si.
Tras poner una reclamación, por darme una cita para resultados(1 minuto de consulta) para 3 semanas despues, consulto el estado de la reclamación 10 días después y ,mucha casualidad, me dicen están con ella y me llama ese día el médico para decirme que tengo que volver a repetir la prueba.
Todo esto ya lo sabe el servicio de Calidad que hace las funciones de atención al paciente y como les comenté mi experiencia con Urología de Quirón no es para recomendar.
En definitiva larga lista de espera y pésimo trato administrativo en una clínica privada. Para no repetir.

Hoy, 30 de Noviembre, hacen dos semanas completas desde que puse una queja por escrito al Hospital  Quirón y también a mi aseguradora Sanitas. La escribí con respeto a pesar de mi enfado, creyendo que a veces todo tiene una explicación y pensando que el dialogo arregla muchas cosas.
Después de dos semanas sin ninguna respuesta a mi queja por una mala intervención médica no doy crédito de lo que me ocurrió.
En concreto, la persona que me intervino me reconoció después de hacer mal su trabajo que él no estaba preparado para dicha operación, porque quien me tenía que haber intervenido le había cambiado el turno de trabajo; por lo tanto me dieron una nueva cita. Es vergonzoso que en esta siguiente cita me ocurrió exactamente lo mismo.
Ahora de nuevo espero turno para ver qué ocurre a la tercera y a ver si alguien me responde.

Aparte de eso, un desastre de hospital, en todos los aspectos: "Administración" horrible, "Atención al cliente" pésima, "Habitación" en la planta 3 al menos son viejas, la máquina de bonos para la televisión no funciona, una máquina de vending con cuatro cosas en la planta 2, te echan (literalmente y te lo recuerdan varias veces) de la habitación a las doce (eso sí, te dejan quedarte en la sala de espera sentadito, qué detallazo por su parte) tras alta por intervención quirúrgica, si necesitas rasurado en la zona de la operación te lo hace el celador en la habitación (sin comentarios)...vamos que para ser un hospital privado se merece no una estrella de valoración, se merece un "menos 20"!!!

Nombre del establecimiento: Hospital Universitario Ruber Juan Bravo (C/Juan Bravo, 49)
content:
Yo fui a esta clínica por la gran valoración que atesoraba el equipo médico en Doctoralia.  Deciros que llevo 5 o 6 intentos de publicar mi opinión en dicha página sobre el equipo médico que me operó y creo que no habrá manera.
Como me habéis pedido desde atención al paciente que os lo cuente, os he escrito pero veo que no me habéis contestado. Lo mismo es que no os llega el correo así que os contesto por aquí. Os cuento mi experiencia por si podéis mejorar en algo. Mi opinión es tal basada en mi experiencia en una resección de colón realizada por el equipo J.C.M.D mediante laparoscopia. Intervención cuya duración, normalmente, se estimada en, aproximadamente, 2 horas (a veces se extienden a 4h ) y que se fue a unas 7 horas y 35 minutos y que, además, hubo que repetirla en otras dos ocasiones en unos 20 días. De la primera operación (sin entrar en más detalles), el resultado fue una isquemia , que desconozco si podría haberse detectado a tiempo antes, con el resultado de gangrena y la amputación total del intestino ascendente y parte del transverso.

Me habría gustado más atención cuando perdí el conocimiento tras la operación (que hubiera venido un medico antes y que hubieran hecho al menos un electro), cuando empecé a vomitar tantísimo (Vomité litros y litros. Desde nuestro punto de vista la barriga estaba especialmente dilatada. Como es lógico, esa cantidad de litros acumulados que expulsé en algún lugar tenían que estar) podían haberse tomado la molestia de sondarme antes) y cuando empecé a orinar cada vez menos y cada vez más rojizo (muy rojizo). Desconozco si la prueba que se me hizo antes de operarme por segunda vez ( una de rx con contraste) podía haberse realizado antes y haber salvado mi intestino.
Después de la segunda operación, se me seccionó el intestino delgado con las bridas (...dicen que por esfuerzos) por lo que hubo que operarme una tercera ocasión y cortar también parte del intestino delgado. Cómo ya no me podían coser para cerrarme hubo que moverme los músculos de la espalda al vientre para hacerme como una faja (algo así no soy médico y no se explicarme)  Después, se me abrió la cicatriz de la ileostomia al retirarme prematuramente los puntos . Tuve tan, tan mala suerte que hasta se "perdieron" las solicitudes para la tramitación con el seguro de un tratamiento para la cicatrización mediante vacío para las heridas abiertas con las que "dejé" el hospital. El seguro médico me aseguró que jamás las recibió. Al final otro médico de otro hospital me pidió esa máquina y mis heridas sanaron.
Así que no se... mi experiencia, por decirlo suave, buena no fue. Ahora llevaré bolsa de por vida, una barriga completamente desfigurada y molestias constantes en la espalda.
Lo bueno es que tenéis un personal en UVI maravilloso, unas buenas personas en atención al paciente y una gran parte de las enfermeras muy eficientes y comprometidas con su trabajo.
Por cierto, tener dos enfermeras  en planta cada 24 enfermos (creo recordar, al menos cuando yo estuve) no ayuda a que la estancia sea buena.
Gracias.

(Translated by Google)
I went to this clinic because of the great appreciation that the medical team at Doctoralia treasured. Tell you that it took 5 or 6 attempts to publish my opinion on that page about the medical team that operated on me and I think there will be no way.
As you have asked me from patient care to tell you about it, I have written to you but I see that you have not answered me. The same thing is that the mail does not reach you so I answer you here. I tell you my experience in case you can improve something. My opinion is based on my experience in a colon resection performed by the J.C.M.D team using laparoscopy. Intervention whose duration is normally estimated at approximately 2 hours (sometimes they extend to 4 hours) and which lasted for about 7 hours and 35 minutes and which, in addition, had to be repeated on two other occasions in about 20 days. From the first operation (without going into more details), the result was an ischemia, which I do not know if it could have been detected in time before, with the result of gangrene and the total amputation of the ascending intestine and part of the transverse.

I would have liked more attention when I lost consciousness after the operation (a doctor had come before and they had done at least one electrocardiogram), when I started to vomit so much (I vomited liters and liters. From our point of view the belly was especially dilated As is logical, that amount of accumulated liters that I expelled somewhere had to be) they could have taken the trouble to probe me before) and when I began to urinate less and less and more and more reddish (very reddish). I do not know if the test that was done before my second operation (an Rx with contrast) could have been done earlier and saved my intestine.
After the second operation, my small intestine was sectioned with the flanges (... they say for efforts) so I had to operate a third time and also cut part of the small intestine. How they could no longer sew me to close me, it was necessary to move the muscles from my back to my belly to make me like a girdle (something like that, I'm not a doctor and I can't explain myself) Later, the ileostomy scar opened when I removed the stitches prematurely. I was so, so unlucky that I even "lost" applications for insurance processing for vacuum healing treatment for open wounds with which I "left" the hospital. The health insurance assured me that he never received them. In the end another doctor from another hospital asked me for this machine and my wounds healed.
So I don't know ... my experience, to put it mildly, was not good. Now I will carry a bag for life, a completely disfigured belly and constant pain in my back.
The good thing is that you have a wonderful ICU staff, good people in patient care and a large part of the nurses who are very efficient and committed to their work.
By the way, having two nurses on the ward for every 24 patients (I think I remember, at least when I was there) does not help the stay to be good.
Thanks.

content:
En urgencias se limitan a "curar" una herida en el tobillo causada por un traumatismo, sin siquiera molestarse en realizar una placa. Tampoco le hacen girarlo ni moverlo y en el informe le ponen que no le duele (cuando no es cierto). Al día siguiente, es el médico de familia el que le tiene que prescribir un antibiótico (pues la herida parece algo infectada) y le dice que puede ser un esguince. Nos dice que deberían haberle hecho una placa.
Mi hermana es enfermera en un Hospital "Público" de Valencia y cualquier traumatismo se envía a Rayos "sin que deba pasar antes por el médico".
Si le sigue doliendo, tiene que volver a Urgencias para que le hagan la placa que debieron hacerle en un principio? Se hace esto para que pase dos veces la tarjeta? Y es acaso porque las compañias de seguro pagan poco? O porque los Hospitales privados quieren rentabilizar al máximo sus servicios?
En cualquiera de los casos, supone una deficiente prestación sanitaria que puede acarrear consecuencias graves y que pueden suceder cuando se comercializa con algo tan serio como lo es la salud.

(Translated by Google)
In the ER, they simply "heal" an ankle injury caused by trauma, without even bothering to perform a plaque. They also do not make him turn or move it and in the report they say that it does not hurt (when it is not true). The next day, it is the family doctor who has to prescribe an antibiotic (since the wound seems somewhat infected) and tells him that it may be a sprain. He tells us they should have made him a plaque.
My sister is a nurse in a "Public" Hospital in Valencia and any trauma is sent to Rayos "without having to go to the doctor first."
If it continues to hurt, do you have to go back to the ER to have the plaque that they should have done at first? Is this done to swipe the card twice? And is it because insurance companies pay little? Or because private hospitals want to make the most of their services?
In any of the cases, it supposes a deficient health provision that can have serious consequences and that can happen when something as serious as health is marketed.

Lamentablemente el personal de esta empresa es extremadamente desagradable. He venido al centro de ginecología del 49 duplicado, tercera planta. No había nadie en la recepción durante 15 minutos. He preguntado a la administrativa de ginecología y me ha contestado que no sabía nada y simplemente de esperar, pero de manera tan desagradable que se nota que los pacientes son un fastidio para ellas. Es una experiencia muy desagradable para un paciente ver que el personal no te quiere ayudar sino que quiere deshacerte de ti lo antes posible para volver a lo suyo a su ordenador. Cuando le comenté algo, se puso aún mas borde diciéndome que no era maleducada sino que me estaba diciendo las cosas y punto. Como puede ser que la empresa no le hace un curso de atención al cliente? Como he leído en otro comentario, no se si los eligen maleducados a propósito o la presión del trabajo y el mal ambiente se refleja en la manera de relacionarse con los pacientes. Por otro lado, la doctora Gennaro es encantadora, muy amable y profesional, un trato maravilloso.

Nombre del establecimiento: Hospital Universitario Ruber Juan Bravo (C/Juan Bravo, 49)
content:
(Translated by Google) We must distinguish between the quality and care of the medical team, in this case Dr. Perera de Gregorio, to whom I put a 10, and the rest of the staff. It is clear that the problem is business, at the hospital management level. It is the company that has decided the action plan that it has legitimately wanted and it is clear that it is not thinking to satisfy the patient / client. They will know how far they want to go. I do not know their intentions. Any other company would have already taken action. I can't believe that most of the staff are rude and rude. Have they been shortlisted like that, on purpose? Or, are they the result of labor abuse? If they are all incompetent, something should be done about it. And if it turns out that unattainable challenges or objectives are demanded of them with insufficient means, we must be realistic. What is clear is that, without quality, these days, they are finished.

My personal experience in the short time I have been with them is a bit of a summary of the more than 200 negative opinions that I have just seen. Nothing to add, I believe them all. But, the most serious thing is that they fail even in the simplest and easily solvable details and, that, is already laziness.

I reiterate that this assessment has nothing to do with the medical team. It refers to the property of the company.
The only way to earn money is by obtaining maximum customer / patient satisfaction.

Es la empresa la que ha decidido el plan de acción que ha querido legítimamente  y está claro que no está pensando para satisfacer al paciente/cliente. Ellos sabrán hasta donde quieren llegar. Desconozco sus intenciones. Cualquier otra empresa ya habría tomado medidas. No puedo creer que la mayor parte del personal sea desagradable e incopetente . ¿Los han preseleccionado así, a propósito? o, ¿son el resultado de maltrato laboral?. Sí son todos incompetentes, habría que hacer algo al respecto. Y si resulta que se les exigen retos u objetivos inalcanzables con insuficentes medios, habrá que ser realistas. Lo que está claro es que, sin calidad, en los tiempos que corren, están acabados.

Mi experiencia personal  en el poco tiempo que llevo con ellos es un poco un resumen de las mas de 200 opiniones negativas que acabo de ver. Nada que añadir, me las creo todas. Pero, lo más grave es que fallan hasta en los detalles más simples y fácilmente solucionables y, eso, ya es desidia.

Reitero, que está valoración no tiene que ver con el equipo médico. Se refiere a la propiedad de la empresa.
La unica manera de ganar dinero es obteniendo la máxima satisfacción de los clientes/pacientes.

Although the following is intended to review a Spanish hospital, I'll write it first in English then in French.

My wife and I had chosen that hospital to have the best condition for our baby to come to this world. Nevertheless the service and the lack of attention we received during our stay last week was clearly unacceptable. Almost everything (the gynaecologist was nevertheless remarkable, I can't deny it) as for me a failure.
The following questions will have to be answered by those people who claimed to be professionals:

-How could I be told to go to our room (2 floors above) and wait patiently to be called while they were supposed to prepare my wife's delivery?

-How can a delivery be exceptionally so fast that a hospital of that calibre can't manage to have both parents in the delivery room?

-How could that night's anaesthetist be so busy with another patient that he couldn't do the epidural to my wife?

-How could my wife be told at least twice they could only call her husband whenever the epidural would be done (thing which never occurred...)?

-How could a nurse tell to a midwife, asking if my wife was in pain, that she was in a rush?

-How could a mother-to-be be  in such distress (no epidural, no husband next to her, no help from the staff) be categorised as a drama queen?

I'd strongly recommend anyone to do exhaustive research about this hospital before considering anything.

Ma femme et moi avions choisi cet hôpital pour que notre bébé ait les meilleures conditions pour venir au monde. Néanmoins, le service et le manque d'attention que nous avons reçus lors de notre séjour la semaine dernière étaient clairement inacceptables. Presque tout (le gynécologue était tout de même remarquable, je ne peux pas le nier) fut pour moi un cuisant échec.
Les personnes qui ont prétendu être des professionnels devront répondre aux questions suivantes:

-Comment ai-je pu être envoyé dans notre chambre (2 étages ci-dessus) et attendre patiemment d'être appelé alors que le personnel était supposé préparer l'accouchement de ma femme?

-Comment un accouchement peut-il être si exceptionnellement rapide pour qu'un hôpital de ce calibre ne puisse pas s'assurer que les deux futurs parents soient ensemble?

-Comment l'anesthésiste cette nuit là pouvait être si occupé avec un autre patient qu'il n'a pas pu faire l'épidurale à ma femme?

-Pourquoi nous avons dit à ma femme au moins deux fois que son mari pourrait seulement descendre la rejoindre quand elle aurait eu son épidurale (chose qui ne s'est jamais produite...)?

-Comment une infirmière a pu dire à une sage-femme, en demandant si ma femme avait mal, qu'elle était pressée?

-Comment une future mère dans une telle détresse (pas de péridurale, pas de mari à côté d'elle, pas d'aide du personnel) peut-elle être classée comme quelqu'un faisant des tonnes?

Je recommande fortement à quiconque de faire des recherches exhaustives sur cet hôpital avant d'envisager quoi que ce soit.

My wife and I had chosen this hospital so that our baby would have the best conditions to come into the world. Nonetheless, the service and lack of attention we received during our stay last week was clearly unacceptable. Almost everything (the gynecologist was remarkable, I can't deny it) was a bitter failure for me.
People who have claimed to be professionals will need to answer the following questions:

I highly recommend anyone to thoroughly research this hospital before considering anything.

Entré en el hospital quiron San José la madrugada del 25 de octubre de 2018, pasada la 1h30 de la madrugada con 4cm de dilatación. Al pasar a la sala para que me pusieran la vía me dejaron ahí un buen rato. Mi marido avisó al personal de la entrada 2 veces para que viniese alguien porque las contracciones eran muy dolorosas. Tardaron bastante.
Cuando vinieron, me bajaron al paritorio y para nuestra sorpresa a mi marido Le dijeron que subiera a la habitación,que en cuanto me pusieran la epidural, Le llamarían al teléfono de la habitación y podría bajar a reunirse conmigo. Nos extrañó bastante, pero nos dijeron que el marido no podía estar presente mientras me pusieran la epidural. Por lo que yo fui sola al paritorio, donde me cambié como pude (nadie me ayudó), ya que las contracciones eran cada vez más fuertes y esperé. Tampoco vino la matrona a examinarme, cosa que también me extrañó.
Vino una enfermera a la que le pregunté por el anastesista. Me dijo que el anestesista estaba ocupado con otra paciente y que tenía que esperar. Le pedí que llamarán a mi marido y me dio la misma respuesta que la enfermera que me había llevado al paritorio : "llamaremos a tu marido cuando te hayan puesto la epidural, ya que él no puede estar presente mientras lo hacen".
Al rato y con unas contracciones muy fuertes, volví a preguntar a la enfermera por el anastesista y por mi marido y me volvió a dar las dos mismas respuestas :  "el anestesista estaba ocupado con otra paciente y mi marido tenía que estar en la habitación hasta que me pusieran la epidural". Por fin oí como una mujer (creo que una matrona) le preguntaba a la enfermera si tenía mucho dolor y la enfermera Le contestó "tiene prisa". La mujer entonces entró a ver qué me pasaba y me preguntó que si quería que me explorase. No entendí porqué me preguntaba, se supone que ese es su trabajo y debería ella valorar si me explora o no. Yo Le respondí que si. Conseguí tumbarme de lado como pude (no recibí ayuda de nadie) y me exploró mientras tenía medio cuerpo tumbado en la camilla y las piernas colgando. Entonces me dijo que estaba de 9cm.
Me dijo que el anestesista me podría poner una anestesia que actuase más rápido, pero que me tenía que sentar. Intenté sentarme, pero no pude, las contracciones eran muy fuertes y nadie me ayudaba. Ya sólo tenía ganas de empujar. Empecé a reclamar a gritos que llamasen a mi marido, que no había derecho a que me tratasen así y una de las mujeres que había ahí me dijo que si quería empujar, que lo hiciese. Me di cuenta que la matrona se volvía hacia el aparato que muestra la frecuencia cardíaca del bebé y las contracciones y vio que no estaba conectado. En ese momento empecé a llorar y a empujar y por fin vi el rostro de la ginecóloga, un gran alivio ya que era la única persona que conocia en ese cuarto y la única persona que me trató como una paciente. Empatizo enseguida conmigo y tomó las riendas de la situación. Conseguí tumbarme boca arriba y empujar para que mi hija empezase a salir. 4 empujones más tarde tenía a mi hija embrazos. Entonces apareció mi marido.
Oí como una de las mujeres me decía que casi dejo sin mano a la enfermera mientras empujaba, un comentario bajo mi punto de vista que se podía haber ahorrado, ya que pedí en repetidas ocasiones que llamasen a mi marido y no lo hicieron.
Tuve la sensación de que el personal de esa noche pensaba que exageraba en todo momento, ni preguntaron si necesitaba algo, ni me exploraron, ni me ayudaron en ningún momento. Si no llego a quejarme tanto, doy a luz sin ni siquiera el ginecólogo!
Nosotros hemos escrito y enviado ya una reclamación a la dirección general de coordinación de la atención al ciudadano y humanización de la asistencia sanitaria.

(Translated by Google)
I entered the Quiron San José hospital in the early morning of October 25, 2018, after 1:30 am with 4cm of dilation. When they went to the living room so they could put the line for me, they left me there for a long time. My husband called the entrance staff 2 times to have someone come because the contractions were so painful. They took a long time.
When they came, they took me down to the delivery room and to our surprise they told my husband to go up to the room, that as soon as they put the epidural on me, they would call him on the room phone and he could come down to meet me. We were quite surprised, but we were told that the husband could not be present while I had the epidural. So I went alone to the delivery room, where I changed as best I could (nobody helped me), since the contractions were getting stronger and I waited. Nor did the matron come to examine me, which also surprised me.
A nurse came and I asked about the anastheist. He told me that the anesthetist was busy with another patient and that he had to wait. I asked her to call my husband and she gave me the same answer as the nurse who had brought me to the delivery room: "We will call your husband when you have the epidural, since he cannot be present while they do it."
After a while and with very strong contractions, I asked the nurse again about the anasthesiologist and my husband and she gave me the same two answers: "The anesthetist was busy with another patient and my husband had to be in the room until get an epidural. " Finally I heard how a woman (I think a midwife) asked the nurse if she was in a lot of pain and the nurse replied "she's in a hurry." The woman then came in to see what was wrong with me and asked me if I wanted her to explore me. I did not understand why she was asking me, this is supposed to be her job and she should assess whether she explores me or not. I answered yes. I managed to lie on my side as best I could (I did not get help from anyone) and he explored me while I had half my body lying on the table and my legs dangling. Then he told me it was 9cm.
He told me that the anesthetist could give me a faster acting anesthesia, but that I had to sit down. I tried to sit up, but I couldn't, the contractions were very strong and no one was helping me. I just wanted to push. I began to shout to call my husband, that there was no right to treat me like that and one of the women there told me that if I wanted to push, to do it. I noticed that the midwife turned to the device that shows the baby's heart rate and contractions and saw that it was not connected. At that moment I started crying and pushing and finally saw the face of the gynecologist, a great relief since she was the only person I knew in that room and the only person who treated me like a patient. He immediately empathized with me and took charge of the situation. I managed to lie on my back and push so that my daughter started to come out. 4 pushes later I had my daughter pregnant. Then my husband appeared.
I heard one of the women tell me that she almost knocked out the nurse while pushing, a comment from my point of view that could have been saved, since I repeatedly asked them to call my husband and they did not.
I had the feeling that the staff that night thought I was exaggerating at all times, they did not ask if I needed anything, they did not explore me, nor did they help me at any time. If I do not complain so much, I give birth without even the gynecologist!
We have already written and sent a claim to the general direction of coordination of citizen care and humanization of health care.

Nefasto hospital, fuimos a urgencias estando de 28 semanas de embarazo por vómitos continuados y la ginecologa de guardia, Maria del Carmen Gutiérrez, nos trató con una gran desconsideración, hasta el punto de poner los ojos en blanco cuando yo le hablaba. Me subieron al potro y sin ninguna pregunta un chico que estaba con ella me fue a meter el espéculo, a lo cual me negué porque no entendí la necesidad por unos vómitos y porque es muy doloroso. La respuesta fue que era por protocolo y que no podían dejarme irme de allí sin hacerlo. Cada vez más nerviosa me volví a negar, a lo que ella de muy malas maneras me dijo que lo haría constar en el informe. Cuando me hizo la ecografia y mi pareja le preguntó si el niño estaba bien, su contestación fue que sólo le podía decir que tenía latido fetal. Ya en el box, la enfermera que me monitorizo fue muy amable, pero otra que me puso la sonda me hizo muchísimo daño y me durmió los dedos, hasta el punto que grité de dolor. Su contestación fue que se "partía" con mi vena porque se movía y que así no le ayudaba en nada. Tuve la mano negra con moratones semanas y hoy todavía siento cosquilleos si la toco por los nudillos. Luego no me pusieron nada, ni un triste suero para la deshidratacion. Cuando llegó otra chica me echaron del box y estuvimos esperando más de dos horas al lado de la puerta del hospital. Salí de allí cansada, nerviosa y peor de lo que había entrado.

En nuestra última revisión con mi ginecólogo, que es el jefe de ese departamento, ya de siete meses y medio, le comenté mi interés por tener un plan de parto y no solo no me explicó si lo contemplaban, sino que se enfadó, como si se le estuviera cuestionando personalmente, dijo que en su opinión los planes de parto muchas veces interferian en la buena marcha de los partos, no me confirmó que se pidiera el consentimiento de la madre para realizarle ciertas técnicas, que la episiotomia se haría casi seguro, y como estaba enfadado nos atendió muy mal el resto de la cita, no nos dijo ni si el niño estaba bien. Nunca puede contactar por teléfono con los servicios de preparación al parto de la clínica Ruber de Juan bravo, donde se supone que hacen las clases de preparación al parto( ya que este hospital no tiene) , por lo que  el ginecólogo me dijo que yo no iba a poder hablar con ninguna matrona antes del parto.

Por supuesto nos hemos visto obligados a cambiar de hospital faltando tan poco para el parto. Una vergüenza el trato y su falta de calidad humana.

A disastrous hospital, we went to the emergency room being 28 weeks pregnant due to continuous vomiting and the gynecologist on duty, Maria del Carmen Gutiérrez, treated us with great disregard, to the point of rolling her eyes when I spoke to her. They put me on the rack and without any questions a boy who was with her went to insert the speculum, to which I refused because I did not understand the need for vomiting and because it is very painful. The answer was that it was by protocol and that they couldn't let me leave without doing it. Increasingly nervous, I once again refused, to which she very badly told me that she would make it appear in the report. When he did the ultrasound and my partner asked him if the boy was okay, his answer was that he could only tell him that he had a fetal heartbeat. Back in the box, the nurse who monitored me was very kind, but another who put the probe on me hurt me a lot and put my fingers to sleep, to the point that I screamed in pain. His answer was that it "broke" with my vein because it moved and that it did not help him at all. My hand was black with bruises for weeks and today it still tickles if I touch it by the knuckles. Then they didn't put anything on me, not even a sad dehydration serum. When another girl arrived, they kicked me out of the box and we waited for more than two hours by the door of the hospital. I left there tired, nervous and worse than I had entered.

In our last review with my gynecologist, who is the head of that department, already seven and a half months old, I told him about my interest in having a birth plan and not only did he not explain if they were contemplating it, but he got angry, as if he was being questioned personally, he said that in his opinion the birth plans often interfered with the smooth running of the deliveries, he did not confirm that the mother's consent was requested to perform certain techniques, that the episiotomy would almost certainly be done, And since he was angry, he treated us very badly for the rest of the appointment, he didn't even tell us if the child was okay. You can never contact the birth preparation services of the Ruber de Juan Bravo clinic by phone, where they are supposed to do the childbirth preparation classes (since this hospital does not have one), so the gynecologist told me that I did not she was going to be able to speak to any midwife before delivery.

Of course we have been forced to change hospitals with so little time for delivery. A shame the treatment and its lack of human quality.

I tell you about my experience. Months ago we made an appointment for a doctor who consults at this PRIVATE hospital. The appointment is for my 16-month-old daughter, to get there I have to travel 20 kilometers. Fortunately, I managed to arrive on time. What is my surprise that when the elevator doors open I see a room crowded with people (more than in social security). I get to the counter and they tell me to go talk to the nurse. What is my surprise when they tell me that they are an hour late. I miss the appointment for 15 minutes and they have to pay me per hour ??? You can imagine the situation. I wait another two months for another date? And if it happens again? ... I'm going to ask when I could have another date. I get to the counter they can give it to me next week. Incredible we went from months to a week.
